DOC.brief_title: A 10-Week , Open-Label , Flexible Dose Adaptive Study Evaluating Efficacy Vortioxetine Subjects With Panic Disorder
DOC.detailed_description: The primary objective study evaluate efficacy Vortioxetine ( 5 , 10 , 20mg ) period 10 week subject PD , without Agoraphobia . The efficacy Vortioxetine evaluate use Mean Change Baseline Panic Disorder Severity Scale ( PDSS ) score reduction occurrence panic attack measure item 1 PDSS Scale 10 week treatment Vortioxetine . This study open-label , adaptive study flexible dose strategy last 10 week . Approximately 20 male female subject age 18aged 18-60 year currently meet DSM-IV criterion PD without Agoraphobia PDSS score > 8 Baseline enrol study .
DOC.criteria: 1 . The subject voluntarily agree participate study free . 2 . The subject meet DSMV criterion PD without Agoraphobia PDSS score > 8 Baseline visit . 3 . The subject age 1860 year old inclusive time consent . 4 . The subject capable understanding comply protocol requirement . 5 . The subject sign Informed Consent Form . No studyrelated procedure may perform subject sign form . 1 . Female subject pregnant nursing , may become pregnant course study . In addition , subject childbearing potential sexually active use adequate contraception signing inform consent throughout duration study . Male subject surgically sterilize , least one year postvasectomy , require use contraceptive . Females childbearing potential define surgically sterilize ( hysterectomy , bilateral oophorectomy tubal ligation ) postmenopausal ( define one year since last regular menses ) . 2 . Subjects past present primary diagnosis psychotic disorder PD without Agoraphobia . 3 . Subjects current uncontrolled comorbid psychiatric disorder PD without agoraphobia . 4 . Subject history alcohol abuse dependence within 12 month prior screen , define DSMV criterion . 5 . Subjects comorbid severe medical diagnosis Cancer , adults chronic heart failure , uncontrolled , longterm type 2 Diabetes , etc . 6 . Subjects history liver disease cirrhosis liver , neoplasm liver , active Hepatitis C. 7 . Subjects weigh less 100lbs Baseline visit . 8 . Subjects history cardiac abnormality include limited , acute cardiovascular event , serious cardiovascular risk , myocardial infarction ( MI ) , unstable angina ( UA ) , percutaneous coronary intervention , coronary artery bypass graft , stroke , deep vein thrombosis/pulmonary embolism within 1 year screening , plan cardiovascular surgery percutaneous coronary angioplasty . 9 . Subjects reasonably judge Investigator base interview information collect ColumbiaSuicide Severity Rating Scale ( CSSRS ) Baseline visit present significant suicide risk , likely require psychiatric hospitalization course study . 10 .
